title: Master Yi nerf wtf??
body:
rito plz wtf gg 9x report

What is this Master Yi nerf?  Yi does not have an ultra strong early game!!

but you hit exactly at his early game damage cause Yi's first item is devourer and no AD at all!!

I dont get this....at level 18, his build wont be changing much, and that true damage is almost the same, what is this nerf/change supposed to accomplish?

Gut Yi's already weak early game so he wont be able to reach his late game at all?

If tank Yi is such a problem, you should be looking at why an assassin champion is building tank to be semi successful in the first place.  Full AD/Crit Yi is nothing more than a clean up assassin and is close to trash tier with all the heavy cc and tanks with damage that we have.  :|


These are the changes if anyone is wondering:

Active's Flat damage increased to 12/19/26/33/40 from 10/15/20/25/30.
Active's AD ratio changed to 25% bonus AD from 10/12.5/15/17.5/20% total AD.

ps titanic hydra damage is also nerfed.  -15

from surrenderat20

replies.body: Our intent with changes to Yi is to nerf tank+on hit builds and leave AD builds at their current level of power. Tank+on hit builds are currently negating one of Yi's main intended weakness (squishiness) without costing him enough damage in exchange.
ty Meddler

I build, late game, if I can reach there, {{item:3930}} {{item:3124}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3139}} {{item:3006}} {{item:3053}}  easy baron solo

I end up with around +350 AD, so around 100 true damage, before and after pbe changed.

with this build I'm not squishy, not one enemy champion that can 1v1 and if there is someone like soraka in my team, you just go in and kill everything over and over again.

so Yi's late game is still there.  Where I struggle is early game, not in jungle clears, but that enemy rammus/amumu/gragas/xin/many others can keep hardcore camping our lanes when Yi  dont offer much

so you balance by nerfing already weak early game so it becomes much harder to reach a said problematic late game, but that said problematic late game is unchanged if you do get there?

Remind me again why in the world do you grab a juggernaut item such as {{item:3053}} on Yi?

Guess that's one sign of why Tank Yi needs to be kicked more by forcing him to build glass cannon while remained squishy.

?

to itemize to not to die instantly after a Q is wrong now?

if you start building glass cannon from the start, high chances are that game will end before you can complete even half of that glass cannon build if  you playing Yi
Master Yi is not ranged, so he can't stay behind huge tank line and AA noobs from safety.  As a melee, you're fighting exactly where enemy team would want you to be, in melee range of entire enemy team.
And isn't that what Meddler was aiming for? To have Yi having a clear weakness in any teamfights, such as his intended squishiness?

With that {{item:3153}} {{item:3930}} {{item:3139}} , and then there's this random shit{{item:3124}} you put there , he's already considered an average God. Put that together with {{item:3053}} is asking nothing more than becoming Saitama.

I still feel like both Steraks and Titanic should be shifted to Bonus HP scalings to reward health stackers exclusively. Steraks as an ADC item is great because it offers AD and Health and that's invaluable against assassins. But it doesn't end there because it also offers you a shield if you take too much damage in a certain time-frame. I mean, in theory Steraks SHOULD be better for champions with more health and all that, but it doesn't work like that right now.

> [{quoted}](name=Naag One,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RdAIgmVa,comment-id=0000000200000000,timestamp=2016-03-11T07:18:45.661+0000)

Yi is a fighter/assassin so it's natural to share squishiness with the assassin class.
Apart from losing crit and lifesteal from a full AD build, tank Yi offers raw AD, a plethora of on-hit damage, high resistances and HP, which removes any risk to him dying whether he makes a mistake or not. You can't die 1v1 or 1v3 either and your ult provides safety from basically any CC that isn't a stun.

So with this in mind, why would anyone build him with AD if tank provides a lot more safety for the same thing?
Tank Fizz and Ekko were kneecapped for the same reason. I'm sure tank Akali will follow soon. And the way you're playing him isn't even that abusive.
Try this {{item:3931}} {{item:3124}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3748}} {{item:1301}} .
Hell, he can use all AD items and mix/match with tank items as he wants.

You'd make the same fuss if suddenly ADCs got the same option of going tanky and dealing the same damage, without even worrying about getting killed.

Your build is not a common Yi build. A much more common build is Devourer, Rageblade or BotRK, pure tank. You don't get BotRK and Rageblade together. You don't buy more AD. Tank. That's how he's most successful.

Your build doesn't have the really problematic late game that we're talking about because it actually builds AD, but that's not the best build right now.

Okay, I've only tried Warrior Yi once, but it actually worked. I got to put out ridiculous amounts of damage early game, which in return won me the game because of how much my lanes snowballed. It's not like Sated Devourer is the only way for Yi, even Cinderhulk works in certain situations.

The issue is that his "intended weakness" makes him bad. 

Also, that's not his "only weakness", he still brings no utility to his team and as such is mediocre in team fights without any set-up. He's still pure damage and melee.

A champion is supposed to have a number of strength and weakness
YI strength are literally "tons of damage", true damage,  be untargetable during alpha strike, clean up fight, good chase potential
Yi weakness are : very squishy, no cc, farm dependent.
As you can see the tank-on hit build remove one of his weakness without touching his strength. 
Yi is a reactive champion, he don't charge in the fight first, he react when is team engage or at enemy mistake.
What's the reasoning behind increasing the true damage, though? Won't that encourage tank+on-hit builds still, since his true damage's improved?

Even with the slight increase in the base damage, the scaling change to bonus instead of total AD is a huge nerf if you are not building a lot of bonus AD. 

with {{item:3931}} {{item:3124}} {{item:3748}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3006}} 
 you have 111 base ad (lvl 18, which you would be at with this build) + 55.5 base ad when Sterak's passive is popped + 54 bonus AD max from guinsoos, + 50 bonus AD from hydra = 270.5 AD.

Currently at max E that gives you 30 + (0.2 x 270.5) = 84.1 true damage per attack.
With nerfs at max rank you get 40 + (0.25 x 104) = 66 true damage per attack, 20 less than before despite the base increase. 

To have the same damage you need 72 more bonus AD than the build I list (basically a full bloodthirster), which would require giving up the DMP or the Steraks in the build to get the necessary AD (or the boots or the devourer).

Thanks, that's a helpful answer. May I point out that Titanic Hydra's AD is getting nerfed? The new patch'd require you to give up more than just DMP or Sterak's to reach the same amount of AD. I feel confident it's a nerf to Tank Yi, thanks for the explanation.

Meddler, full damage Yi is TOO squishy. In a meta like this one, where everyone is running burst to try and control marksmen, and marksmen themselves have burst due to their 60+% crit, Yi doesn't have enough time to attack more than two or three times before dying. 

This change is going to either nerf him but not be significant enough to affect his build path (he will still go on hit tank, just deal slightly less damage) or it will be significant enough and remove him from the game entirely (because Warrior Shiv Hydra Yi doesn't live long enough to deal any damage).

I suggest you pair this with something, perhaps a % increase in the AD ratio on Alpha Strike for each champion hit beyond the first? So if I Q the front line and hit the support, mid and carry with it, the front line could take 100% AD, the support could take 120%, the mid could take 140%, and the carry could take 160%? 

Either that or update Master Yi to stop being reliant on critical strikes. He doesn't live long enough to attack, and if he's going to be a true assassin instead of a Skirmisher he needs to stack raw AD.
